linkGetting Started

Assuming you've already seen this page page, you're ready to start using Frost. ðŸ’ª

To get you started with Frost, we'll be creating a simple project called frost-starter.

Frost has a starter boilerplate that we'll be using to get you started.

1link$

2link$frost --init // --> cotains a template for a new project

3link$

Here's the directory structure of the project we just created.

1linkstarter 

2linkâ”œâ”€â”€ .gitignore

3linkâ”œâ”€â”€ package.json

4linkâ”œâ”€â”€ README.md

5linkâ”œâ”€â”€ src

6linkâ”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ index.frost

7linkâ”‚   â””â”€â”€ components

8linkâ”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ description.md

9linkâ”œâ”€â”€ public 

10linkâ”‚   â””â”€â”€ frost.png

11linkâ”œâ”€â”€ frost.json

12linkâ”œâ”€â”€ frost.metadata.json

13linkâ””â”€â”€ .git

14link

The first thing that might come to your mind is index.frost. This is the file that is going to be built into html by frost.

This is basically the frost templating engine.

If you open up src/index.frost you might see this:

1link<!DOCTYPE html>

2link<html lang="en">

3link<head>

4link    <meta charset="UTF-8">

5link    <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge">

6link    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">

7link    <link rel="shortcut icon" href="./frost.png" type="image/png">

8link    <title><frost>pageTitle</frost></title>

9link    <style>

10link        @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Poppins:wght@300&display=swap');

11link

12link        * {

13link            margin: 0;

14link            padding: 0;

15link        }

16link

17link        body {

18link            background-color: #232323;

19link            color: #FFFFFF;

20link            margin-top: 8rem;

21link            font-family: 'Poppins', sans-serif;

22link        }

23link

24link        main {

25link            display: flex;

26link            justify-content: center;

27link            align-items: center;

28link            flex-direction: column;

29link        }

30link

31link        .buttons {

32link            display: flex;

33link            justify-content: center;

34link            align-items: center;

35link            gap: 0.5rem;

36link            margin-top: 1rem;

37link        }

38link

39link        img {

40link            height: 15rem;

41link            width: 15rem;

42link            border-radius: 50%;

43link            user-select: none;

44link            margin-bottom: 2rem;

45link        }

46link

47link        a {

48link            padding: 1rem;

49link            cursor: pointer;

50link            border: none;

51link            background-color: #00a5a5;

52link            color: white;

53link            border-radius: 0.3rem;

54link            width: 10%;

55link            font-weight: bold;

56link            text-align: center;

57link            text-decoration: none;

58link        }

59link

60link        a:hover {

61link            background-color: #008080;

62link        }

63link

64link        h1 {

65link            font-weight: bold;

66link            text-transform: uppercase;

67link            font-size: 3rem;

68link        }

69link

70link        p {

71link            font-size: 1.3rem;

72link        }

73link    </style>

74link</head>

75link<body>

76link    <main>

77link        <img draggable="false" src="./frost.png" alt="icon">

78link        #include "./components/description.md"  <!--> This is where we import our markdown element. The element renders itself in the exact place it is being imported -->

79link    </main>

80link    <div class="buttons">

81link        <a href="https://frost.js.org" target="_blank">Documentation</a>

82link        <a href="https://github.com/DevSnowflake/frost" target="_blank">GitHub</a>

83link    </div>

84link

85link    <frost typescript>  <!--> Frost compiles Typescript to JS(with an inbuilt typechecker!) -->

86link        const titleElm = document.querySelector("h1");

87link

88link        if (titleElm) {

89link            const colorGen = (): string => {

90link                return `#${(Math.floor(Math.random() * 0xFFFFFF) + 1).toString(16)}`;

91link            };

92link

93link            setInterval(() => {

94link                titleElm.style.color = colorGen();

95link            }, 2e3);

96link        }

97link    </frost>

98link</body>

99link</html>

Through the whole file, it is evident that the frost templating engine is just simple HTML with an added amount of features.

<frost>pageTitle<frost> - This is the variable that will be replaced with the title of the page.

The variable is contained in frost.metadata.json.

1link{

2link    "pageTitle": "Hello Frost" // --> The metadata may contain a numerous amount of other variables.

3link}

The frost.json file contains the configurations for the project.
